name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** Do not use information from a needle core biopsy to assign primary tumor.

**Note 2:** Involvement of the prostatic urethra does not alter the extension code.

**Note 3:** "Frozen pelvis" is a clinical term which means tumor extends to pelvic sidewall(s).  In the absence of a more detailed statement of involvement, code in SEER Mets.
footnotes:
\# Considered localized in Historic Stage
\## Considered regional in Historic Stage
\### Considered distant in Historic Stage
\*** Considered distant in 1977 Summary Staging Guide
rows: In situ: In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive

Clinically inapparent tumor:
    Stage A
    T1a, T1b, T1c
Confined to the prostate:
    Involvement of one lobe, NOS

    More than one lobe involved 
    T2b

Confined to the prostate, NOS

Arising in prostatic apex
Extension to prostatic apex##

Invasion into (but not beyond) prostatic capsule##

Intracapsular involvement only

Stage B

Localized, NOS

Clinically inapparent:
    Incidental histologic finding (for example, on TURP), (clinically inapparent)
    Tumor identified by needle biopsy (clinically inapparent) 
       Example - for elevated PSA

Clinically apparent: 
    Involvement in one lobe/side, NOS 
    Involves one half of one lobe/side or less 
    Involves more than one half of one lobe/side, but not both lobes/sides
    Involves both lobes/sides 

Clinically apparent tumor confined to prostate, NOS

Stated as T1 (T1a, T1b, T1c, T1 [NOS]) or T2 (T2a, T2b, T2c, T2 [NOS])

Regional by direct extension only
